message.content:
cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.CV, cs.NE, cs.CL

This paper deals with the problem of catastrophic forgetting in neural networks, which is a common issue in machine learning and artificial intelligence. The paper proposes new metrics and benchmarks for comparing different mechanisms designed to mitigate this problem. Therefore, the most likely sub-categories are cs.LG (Machine Learning), cs.AI (Artificial Intelligence), and cs.CV (Computer Vision). Additionally, the paper also deals with sound data, which suggests that it could also belong to cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) or cs.CL (Computation and Language).
